channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2023081382
item.description:
Report X-2023081382

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AUDITOR NOTED THAT THE PACKAGE HAD A SMALL STAIN, AND NOTIFIED THE RESPONDER, WHO BROUGHT THE PACKAGE TO THE PROCESSING AREA. DURING INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED LEAKAGE CAME FROM LOOSE CAP ON INNNER CONTAINER. THE PACKAGE WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP USING THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET.

item.title: Report X-2023080770
item.description:
Report X-2023080770

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: manager discovered a damaged hazmat as it was being unloaded from a van on the 900 van line and called it out to QA. HESS specialist responded to the call and went to fetch it. HESS specialist placed it in a lined tote and brought it back to the damage area, where they placed it atop the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one bottle leaked a small amount due to loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023080757
item.description:
Report X-2023080757

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: STEWARTVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was placed on the back end of a trailer with no packages to support it and keep it upright, this package could have been placed inside a fuller trailer with packages to support it and keep it from moving around and tipping over on its side. DescribePack: the package tipped over and the cap came off slightly which then caused liquid to leak out of the jug. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was removed from the trailer and placed upright and brought to the hazmat cage in the facility

item.title: Report E-2023080891
item.description:
Report E-2023080891

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: FARMINGTON
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 15, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1992 were punctured by a faulty skid and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EX Environmental (EX) to remediate the site. EX personnel unloaded the freight and deployed granular absorbents to the release. The crew then containerized all UN1992-impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

QA responded and went to retrieve it with a lined tote, bringing it back to the damage area and placing it atop the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. item.title: Report X-2023080683
item.description:
Report X-2023080683

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged package was discovered this morning due to the package letting off a strong smell. as it turned out, several of the bottles inside had begun to leak, and the smell made its way outside of the ziptied plastic bag they were in. someone placed a code 10 on the package as well as a code 39, pending inspection, and brought it over to the damage area. placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: three bottles leaked varying amounts due to loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023080682
item.description:
Report X-2023080682

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged hazmat was called out to QA after someone accidentally dropped it and it fell onto the ground, leaking a small amount. QA admins responded and retrieved it, placing it in a lined tote and bringing it to the damage area, moving it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: the upper rim of the drum is dented inward, and a very small amount of liquid leaked out to stain the label. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

DescribePack: two bottles leaked due to loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one 1500 pound large forklift battery(un2794) had fallen over and released 2 gallons of acid. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023080529
item.description:
Report E-2023080529

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: FARMINGTON
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 28, 2023, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1993 was punctured and released approximately 25-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EX Environmental (EXE) to remediate the impacted site. EXE personnel offloaded the trailer and deployed granular absorbents to the release. The crew then utilized hand tools to containerize all UN1993-impaced material into three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.
